IRW300H1-F-20235.orgName: Industrial Relations and Human Resources, Centre for (IRE)
IRW300H1-F-20235.courseTitle: Effective Communication and Strategic Writing in Organizations
IRW300H1-F-20235.courseDescription: Focused on understanding and crafting strategic, effective, and ethical written and verbal communications in organizations. The technical components of organizational writing and persuasion, how messages are perceived from multiple stakeholders, and the conflicts that can arise over organizational miscommunications, particularly between managers and workers.
IRW300H1-F-20235.webTimetableInstructions:
Review the course description/restrictions before enrolling in this course.

  • ACORN does not check for prerequisites/exclusions in real time. Students enrolled in courses for which they do not have the published requirements may have their registration cancelled at any time.
  • Do not enrol in course conflicts as accommodations will not be granted.
  • Contact the Program office (IRHR@utoronto.ca) if you have any questions.
IRW300H1-F-20235.deliveryInstructions: The course includes pre-recorded lectures.  This class meets synchronously for two hours per week with an additional minimum 2 hours per week of asynchronous/synchronous discussions.
